usage_instructions:
To run the experiment comparing ResNet-50 and Swin-B backbones on OpenLane-V2 subset A, follow these steps:

1. First, train the baseline ResNet-50 model for 24 epochs (default setting):
   ```
   ./tools/dist_train.sh projects/configs/topomlp_setA_r50_wo_yolov8.py 8 --work-dir=./work_dirs/topomlp_setA_r50_wo_yolov8
   ```

2. For the Swin-B model with extended training, modify the config file by changing line 311 in projects/configs/topomlp_setA_swinb_wo_yolov8.py from `runner = dict(type='EpochBasedRunner', max_epochs=24)` to `runner = dict(type='EpochBasedRunner', max_epochs=48)`, then run:
   ```
   ./tools/dist_train.sh projects/configs/topomlp_setA_swinb_wo_yolov8.py 8 --work-dir=./work_dirs/topomlp_setA_swinb_wo_yolov8_e48
   ```

3. After training, evaluate both models to compare their performance:
   ```
   ./tools/dist_test.sh projects/configs/topomlp_setA_r50_wo_yolov8.py work_dirs/topomlp_setA_r50_wo_yolov8/latest.pth 8 --eval=bbox
   ./tools/dist_test.sh projects/configs/topomlp_setA_swinb_wo_yolov8.py work_dirs/topomlp_setA_swinb_wo_yolov8_e48/latest.pth 8 --eval=bbox
   ```

The evaluation will output the Overall Lane Score (OLS) and other topology metrics, allowing you to compare the performance between the ResNet-50 baseline and the Swin-B model with extended training. According to the paper, this should show an improvement from an OLS score of 38.2 to 43.7 when using Swin-B with extended training.
